process_details.description: The Authorize Referral business process is responsible for referrals between providers that the State Medicaid Agency (SMA) authorizes. This business process may authorize referrals for services such as: Specialty care, Diagnostic services, Therapeutic services, Durable Medical Equipment (DME), Home health services, Long-term care services. The authorization may be automatic based on pre-established criteria or may require manual review and approval.
trigger_events: Receive referral information from Health Information Exchange (HIE).
process_steps: Determine if manual review is required.
If manual review required, assign to reviewer.
Review clinical information and medical necessity.
Make authorization decision (approve, deny, or pend).
Generate notifications to providers and member.
shared_data: Member data store including demographics and eligibility
Provider data store including network information
Health Benefits data store including coverage and authorization rules
process_details.constraints: Authorization requirements vary by state, program, and service type. Some services require prior authorization while others may be authorized automatically. Time limits for authorization decisions are specified by state and federal regulations.
failures: Referral does not meet authorization criteria.
Member is not eligible for requested service.
Referring provider is not authorized to make referral.
Insufficient clinical information to make decision.
